item.title: Maleka add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "Tell me, what is it you plan to do with your one wild and precious life?" -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Maleka add a quote by Michelle Tea
item.description: "you are right where you should be / now act like it" -- Michelle Tea

item.title: Maleka add a quote by Elena Avila
item.description: "I am the woman who glows in the dark, I'll stay awake forever if I have to." -- Elena Avila

item.title: Maleka add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "The only way to deal with an unfree world is to become so absolutely free that your very existence is an act of rebellion." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Maleka add a quote by Suheir Hammad
item.description: "Your war drum ain't / louder than this breath." -- Suheir Hammad

item.title: Maleka add a quote by Ewuare Osayande
item.description: "If you put the words on a page and you believe in them, then itâ€™s a poem." -- Ewuare Osayande

item.title: Maleka add a quote by Betty Smith
item.description: "The world was hers for the reading." -- Betty Smith

item.title: Maleka add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Wicked people never have time for reading. It's one of the reasons for their wickedness." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Maleka add a quote by Bell Hooks
item.description: "She wanted me to remember that pleasure is political--for the capacity to relax and play renews the spirit and makes it possible for us to come to the work of writing clearer, ready for the journey. (bell hooks about Toni Cade Bambara)" -- Bell Hooks

item.title: Maleka add a quote by Toni Cade Bambara
item.description: "For people sometimes believed that it was safer to live with complaints, was necessary to cooperate with grief, was all right to become an accomplice in self-ambush... Take heart to flat out decide to be well and stride into the future sane and whole." -- Toni Cade Bambara

item.title: Maleka add a quote by Toni Cade Bambara
item.description: "I am one beautiful and powerful son of a bitch,' he told himself. 'Smart as a whip, respected, prosperous, beloved and valuable. I have the right to be healthy, happy and rich, for I am the baddest player in this arena or any other. I love myself more than I love money and pretty women and fine clothes. I love myself more than I love neat gardens and healthy babies and a good gospel choir. I love myself as I love The Law. I love myself in error and in correctness, waking or sleeping, sneezing, tipsy, or fabulously brilliant I love myself doing the books or sitting down to a good game of poker. I love myself making love expertly, or tenderly and shyly, or clumsily and inept. I love myself as I love The Master's Mind,' he continued his litany, having long ago stumbled upon the prime principle as a player--that self-love produces the gods and the gods are genius. It took genius to run the Southwest Community Infirmary. So he made the rounds of his hospital the way he used to make the rounds of his houses to keep the tops spinning, reciting declarations of self-love." -- Toni Cade Bambara

item.title: Maleka add a quote by Toni Cade Bambara
item.description: "Write a lot and hit the streets. A writer who doesn't keep up with what's out there ain't gonna be out there." -- Toni Cade Bambara

item.title: Maleka add a quote by Toni Cade Bambara
item.description: "The dream is real, my friends. The failure to make it work is the unreality." -- Toni Cade Bambara

item.title: Maleka add a quote by Toni Cade Bambara
item.description: "Writing is one of the ways I participate in transformation." -- Toni Cade Bambara

item.title: Maleka add a quote by Toni Cade Bambara
item.description: "The purpose of a writer is to make revolution irresistible." -- Toni Cade Bambara

item.title: Maleka add a quote by Cheryl Strayed
item.description: "Nobody will protect you from your suffering. You can't cry it away or eat it away or starve it away or walk it away or punch it away or even therapy it away. It's just there, and you have to survive it. You have to endure it. You have to live through it and love it and move on and be better for it and run as far as you can in the direction of your best and happiest dreams across the bridge that was built by your own desire to heal." -- Cheryl Strayed

item.title: Maleka add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "How can I begin anything new with all of yesterday in me?" -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: Maleka add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "Ring the bells that still can ring Forget your perfect offering There is a crack in everything That's how the light gets in." -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: Maleka add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "Don't call yourself a secret unless you mean to keep it." -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: Maleka add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "If you don't become the ocean, you'll be seasick every day." -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: Maleka add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "Remember when I moved in you and the holy dove was moving too, and every breath we drew was, "Hallelujah." -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: Maleka add a quote by Ayana Mathis
item.description: "Maybe we have only a finite amount of love to give. We're born with our portion, and if we love and are not loved enough in return, it's depleted." -- Ayana Mathis

item.title: Maleka add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Too often the people complain that they have done nothing with their lives and then they wait for somebody to tell them that this isn't so." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Maleka add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Things get bad for all of us, almost continually, and what we do under the constant stress reveals who/what we are." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Maleka add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "I remember awakening one morning and finding everything smeared with the color of forgotten love." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Maleka add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "Music has always been a matter of Energy to me, a question of Fuel. Sentimental people call it Inspiration, but what they really mean is Fuel. I have always needed Fuel. I am a serious consumer. On some nights I still believe that a car with the gas needle on empty can run about fifty more miles if you have the right music very loud on the radio." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Maleka add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "It's only after we've lost everything that we're free to do anything." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Maleka add a quote by Abdu'l-Baha
item.description: "Where there is love, nothing is too much trouble and there is always time." -- Abdu'l-Baha

item.title: Maleka add a quote by Abdul-Baha
item.description: "My heart is in a constant state of thanksgiving." -- Abdul-Baha

item.title: Maleka add a quote by Sun Ra
item.description: "If death is the absence of life, then death's death is life." -- Sun Ra
